This is a prime example of how NOT to be a parent...even though, at least, they did something.
 
 It is evident that all areas of America are not like Texas where you, as a parent, (I'm talking about a loving, caring, responsible parent) can have control over your own children.
 
 I would move if I couldn't give those bratty kids a good spanking, set them straight and be done with it.
 
 But, in this case, it had gone on for some time and the parents allowed it.
 
 It's only going to get worse when laws prohibit parents from being parents.

I must be alone in my thinking, (yeah! there is a first). I think these parents have tried counseling and tough love and it hasnt worked. This is the MTV, reality telelvsion world now. Many parents would let their kids rot while they go pick up a welfare check and get high.
 
 Here we have two parents willing to sleep in a tent on the driveway, just to teach their kids a lesson. Sorry, there are not that many parents out there these days willing to go to extremes for their kids. Not to mention the fact it is working. Go fo it!  The problem is, that these parents are only facing this now because they never gave their children the discipline that they should have had from early on. If my kid refused to mow the grass, I would have tied him to the lawn mower and told him he can only come in after the grass is cut. If they refused to do the laundry, they would have worn the same dirty clothes until they couldn't stand their own stench. If they hit me, they get hit back. If they slam their door, it gets taken off the hinges, and they don't have a door to slam. If they play their stereo too loud after I tell them to turn it down, the speakers get locked away. 12 and 17 are not the ages to teach children right from wrong. These parents wasted valuable years in which they should have shown love, but tough love when needed. They are reaping the "rewards" of bad parenting, and good for them, they deserve it.

 As you hinted at, I wonder if this little experiment will change anything. By the age of 17 most personality features are already in place. Personality is an incredibly stable part of who we are--your parents pouting in the front yard certainly isn't going to chage who you are. Even by 12 it is an uphill battle. 
 
 I would agree this is a case of 'too little, too late.' Too bad for the kids, the parents, and the rest of us who have to put up with this garbage from millions of families across America.
 
 Whistler
